С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 3 года назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей женской одежды. Ее эффективность помогает ей быть успешной в бизнесе. Она продает свой товар на местном рынке и имеет большой круг клиентов. У нее тонкий вкус и она умеет выбрать товар, который имеет большой спрос. Несмотря на все ее достоинства, мощная конкуренция  делового мира, заставляет ее быть внимательной и обновлять товар каждый сезон. Она должна купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США  для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Madina is a clever and hardworking woman. She is 21 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. With the goal of supporting her family with all the necessities, she started her own business three years ago buying and selling women's clothing. Her performance helps her to be successful in business. She sells her goods at the local market and has a large circle of customers. She has good taste and she knows how to choose goods that are in great demand. 

Despite all her advantages, there is powerful competition in the business world, forcing her to be careful and to update items every season. She needs to buy goods for the new season but she does not have enough means to do so. 

She is requesting a loan of US$3,000 to buy goods for the new season.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Eunice has operated a farming business, selling farming products to her neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality affecting her crops to be her major challenge. 

Eunice is requesting KSHS 15,000 to boost her kiosk, purchase seeds and farm inputs.  She dreams of establishing a grocery shop in the near future.

loans.use: to boost her kiosk, purchase seeds and farm inputs.

loans.name: Volodya

texts.en: Valodya lives in the village of Verin Khotanan with his wife and his retired mother. Volodya also has three daughters who are married and live separately with their families. Volodya has been engaged in farming for a long time and his wife helps him around the farm. In their farm, they are busy with cattle breeding and poultry farming. They have four cows, four calves and fifteen chickens. All the products that they have from farming they sell to resellers and they have many loyal customers in different towns, such as Kapan and Kajaran. Volodya wants to enrich the quantity of his farm’s cattle and therefore he is asking for a loan of 250 AMD to buy two more calves. He hopes very much that Kiva lenders will support him, since it is the second time that he has cooperated with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two more calves and to enlarge his animal breeding capacity.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is single. She has received basic schooling through to junior high school. Alberta hawks and sells ladies panties, brassieres and jewelry in Wegbe, Hohoe, and surrounding communities. She has done this for four years now to support herself, since she couldn’t continue her education. Alberta is responsible for the general upkeep of herself and her parents. Alberta will use this loan to purchase dozens of ladies underwear. Alberta plans to save the new profits from her expanded business and improve her business and acquire a shop soon.

loans.use: to purchase dozens of ladies underwear

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing business

loans.name: Anzazi

texts.en:
Anzazi is a married woman and has been blessed with kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has a business selling fish, which has been operational for over two years. In addition, she sells paraffin. She mentions seasonality as a challenge in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. With this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 25 лет. Она красивая и умная женщина. Шахноза замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще маленькие. Шахноза умелая мастерица-парикмахер. Она в течение нескольких лет училась в парикмахерской, и теперь она уверена в себе, что может открыть свой салон красоты и преподнести услугу на высшем уровне. Она обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она научилась составить свой бизнес план и узнала много новой информации о введение бизнеса. Она будет преподнести такие услуги, как стрижка, укладка волос, прически, а также она будет продавать парфюмерию. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США, чтобы купить необходимые инструменты парикмахера, арендовать помещение и купить парфюмерию. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 25 years old. She is a beautiful and clever woman. Shahnoza is married and has two children. The children are still small. 

Shahnoza is a skilled master-hairdresser. She spent several years studying in a hair salon, and now she is sure of herself that she can open her own beauty salon and offer services at the highest level. 

She took a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She learned how to make a business plan and learned a lot of new information about running a business. She will present services such as haircuts, hair styling, hair styles, and she will also sell perfume.

She is requesting a loan of US$3,000 to buy the needed instruments for a salon, to rent premises, and to purchase perfumes.

loans.use: to buy perfume and equipment for a beauty salon, and to rent premises for organizing a new business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina produces and sells cassava dough in Wegbe, Hohoe. She is married and has eight children. Her husband is a driver. Paulina has been producing and selling cassava dough for seven years now. She helps with the feeding in her home. Her loan will be used to buy tubers of cassava from the local farmers and get laborers to help peel the cassava. It will also be money for milling. She hopes to put the new profits from her business back into her business to enable her to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy tubers of cassava from the local farmers and get laborers to help peel the cassava

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 4 года назад она начала свой бизнес предоставлением услугой такси.  Она очень хорошо водит машину. Она старается преподнести услугу перевозки пассажира на высшем уровне. В начале для нее было очень трудно, как женщине начать бизнес с услугой такси. Ее муж тоже занимается услугой такси и помогает жене привлечь клиентов. Она хочет расширить бизнес для увеличения дохода и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2650 долларов США для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shahlo is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. In order to provide her family with all the necessities, she started her own business four years ago providing taxi services. She is a very good driver. She tries to provide transportation services for passengers at the highest level. 

At the beginning, it was very difficult as a woman to start a taxi service business. Her husband also provides taxi services and helps his wife to attract customers. 

She wants to expand the business to increase revenue and thus to improve living conditions. 

She is requesting a loan of US$2,650 to buy an automobile.

loans.use: to buy a new car for developing a taxi business

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is 31 years old and married with three children who are 2 and 10 years old. She runs a palm oil business in Moriba town, Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school. She began this business to create a permanent source of income to educate her children.

She's been in this business for five years and sells palm oil. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more local food like cassava, palm oil and beans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her installment. In the future, she would like to build a permanent business store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more local food like cassava, palm oil and beans.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is a petty trader from Wegbe, Hohoe. Peace has received education to middle school level but could not go further because she wanted to do trading. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. Peace has been into petty trading for the past 30 years. She gives financial support to her husband to enable him to pay for their children's schooling and also to feed their home. Her loan will be used to buy utensils, sleeping mats, plastic baskets and bowls. She intends to save the new profits from her business for her old age.

loans.use: to buy utensils, sleeping mats, plastic baskets and bowls

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past years, she has operated a detergent-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. She dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase 36 liters of detergents for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 36 liters of detergents for resale.

loans.name: Jarai

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 46-year-old Jarai from Moriba town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 13 and 23 years old. Her children are currently attending school. She began her business because she wanted to contribute to supporting the home. 

Jarai runs an egg business. She sells a variety of food commodities like eggs, biscuits and soft drinks. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. Jarai says that the sales are quite encouraging and her customer rate has improved.

Jarai has requested a loan in order to purchase more eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to expand her business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to have a permanent residence. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, biscuits and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat is a kind woman. She is 29 years old, single and lives with her parents. She always tries to be informed with the news and to be a successful lady. She is a worker. She has been working for more than six years at an organization as a technician. Sharofat has a small salary, which is not enough for repairing the house. They live in an old house, which is in bad condition. 

Sharofat plans to repair all the rooms and the kitchen. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 US to repair her house. In this way, she will make her living conditions better. Each month, she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Varbah

texts.en: Varbah is 49 years old and lives in West Point, which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married with three children between 21 and 34 years old. She did not go to school, and she is a business woman. Her husband sells children's used clothes. Supporting her home makes her proud of her business. Over the past ten years, she has been running a table in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little money she got from her mother. She sells six days every week, spending 10 hours on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, Vita [a juice drink made by Coca Cola for the African market], bitter ball [an eggplant-like vegetable], etc., for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, Vita, bitter ball, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Doña Esther es una mujer viuda, madre de cuatro hijos adultos; ella es comerciantes desde hace 7 años, cuando inició su propio negocio de ventas de mercancía variada, para salir adelante con sus propios esfuerzos.  Los productos de su oferta, como ropa interior y exterior, cosméticos y perfumería, los vende a crédito y de contado entre amigos, familiares y vecinos, que se han convertido en su mejor clientela, muchas de ellas le pagan poco a poco, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades los artículos que compran en el negocio, donde encuentran una vitrina surtida y los eligen. Doña Esther ha recibido dos financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante los cuales ha logrado crecimiento en su mercado, credibilidad y un buen inventario, que hace que ella sea oportuna en sus pedidos. En la actualidad le compra a otra comerciante y quiere hacerlo en un mayor volumen y a un mejor precio. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará artículos de aseo personal, maquillaje y calzado que tiene encargado por su clientela. Esta inversión mejorará su diversidad y dará crecimiento a su negocio haciendo que tenga éxito este crédito. Su mayor desafío y meta es tener más ingresos para ayudar a  sus amados nietos y por ello se esmera día a día en su trabajo con el fin de lograrlo.
texts.en:
Esther is a widow, and she has 4 adult children.  She has been working as a merchant for 7 years.  She started her business selling a variety of merchandise so that she could get ahead through her own efforts.  She sells products such as clothing and undergarments, cosmetics, and perfumes.  She sells on cash and credit to her friends, relatives, and neighbors, who have become her best customers.  Many of them pay her gradually over time, according to their ability, for the items that they purchase in the business, where they find a glass display case stocked with items to choose from.  

Esther has taken 2 loans with the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With these loans, she has managed to grow in her market, with increased credibility and a good inventory that enables her to fill her orders in a timely manner.  She now buys from another merchant, and she wants to make her purchases in bulk and at a better price.  For this reason, she has applied for a Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy toiletries, makeup and shoes that her customers have ordered.  This investment will give her a greater variety of products, allowing her to grow the business and have success with this loan.  Esther's main challenge and goal is to have more income to help her beloved grandchildren.  To this end, she strives each day in her work to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, makeup and shoes

loans.name: Elba Santiaga

texts.es:
La señora Elba de 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Managua, es madre de 5 hijos, ella es dueña de un kiosco negocio que inicio hace 7 años , su esposo trabaja reparando cocinas su negocio lo tiene dentro de un colegio cristiano fue en un momento de crisis muy fuerte que paso que la motivo a invertir lo poco que tenía en un kiosco. Actualmente la mayoría de sus clientes solo los estudiantes de primaria y secundaria cada año es más la afluencia de estudiantes por eso necesita invertir en la compra de más productos. Ella usara el financiamiento para comprar gaseosas, caramelos, pan, galletas, jugos, snacks, frutas, repostería. 
Uno de sus proyectos es poner una pulpería en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Elba, 56, lives in the city of Managua.  She is the mother of 5 children, and she also owns a kiosk business that she started up 7 years ago.  Her husband works repairing stoves.  Her business is located in a Christian school.  She got the motivation to invest the little that she had in the kiosk business at the time of a very difficult crisis.  Now, most of her customers are students in the elementary and secondary schools.  Every year, there are more students, and so she needs to invest in more products.  Elba will use this loan to buy soft drinks, caramels, bread, cookies, juices, snacks, fruits and pastries.

One of Elba's plans is to set up a grocery store in the house where she lives.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, caramels, bread, cookies, juices, snacks, fruits and pastries

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Ramatu from Moriba town Bo. She is married with five children between the ages of 8 and 22 years old. Three of her children are going to school. She began her business because her husband is not taking care of the home, so she wants to create income to support her children and divorce her husband.

Ramatu runs a baby clothing business; she sells different types of baby items like baby oil and baby clothes. She has been running this business for two years. She works at the business every day, moving around her environment to introduce her baby clothing materials. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of finances to expand her business.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy different kinds of baby clothing material. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and educate her children. In the future, she plans to become an international business woman. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of baby clothing material.

loans.name: Reyna Isaura

texts.es: La señora Reyna, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo y su hijo, ella tiene su negocio establecido en su casa de habitacion, venta de Ropa de Segunda, su esposo labora para una Farmacia Privada, entre los dos se apoyan con los gastos del hogar ya que para ellos su prioridad es mejorar de condiciones, con la ganancias que doña Reyna obtiene compra materiales para su casa, ya que su mayor sueño es terminar de construirla, con este credito compra paca de Ropa y quiere aprovechar la incversion para comprar paca de Zapatos ya que los clientes le dicen que lleve a vender zapatos, Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le han brindado
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and child. She has a business in her home where she sells secondhand clothing. Her husband works at a privately-owned pharmacy. Between the two of them, they are able to pay for the household expenses since improving their conditions is a priority for them.

With the income that Doña Reyna earns, she is able to buy materials for her house. Her greatest wish is to finish the construction. With this loan she will buy a bale of clothing. She also wants to take advantage of this opportunity to buy a pack of shoes since her customers have said that she should sell them. Reyna is grateful for the support from AFODENIC and the Kiva funds that have been offered to her.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing and a pack of shoes.

loans.name: Kivinya

texts.en:
Kivinya, age 58, is married and has ten children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is medical bills for the family.

For the past three months, she has operated a business selling poultry. She sells to her neighbors, restaurant operators and passersby. Her major challenge is poultry disease outbreak.

With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Chidodo

texts.en:
Chidodo is married and has children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling fruit. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruit sellers.

With this 15,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase sacks of oranges, mangoes, watermelons and bananas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges, mangoes, watermelons and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El Sr. Victor es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 33 años, está casado con la Sra. Mabel de 28 años,  ambos tienen un hijo, el cual es el motivo de lucha de ambos, y por quien se están esforzando al máximo.
El se dedica a la producción y ventas de panificados y confites, comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo han ido creciendo y hoy en día ya tienen muy buena clientela, y quieren poder mejorar cada día mas. Ambos son personas muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
El cliente con este crédito va comprar materia prima para su producción como ser harina, levadura, sal, azúcar, dulces y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes buenos productos como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor is from the city of Santaní. He is 33 years old and married to Sra. Mabel, age 28. They have one child who is the driving force for both of them, so they strive to do their best.

Victor produces and sells baked goods and sweets. He says that thanks to his efforts he has been growing and now has a very good clientele. Victor wants to be able to improve with each passing day. Both he and his wife are hardworking and enterprising individuals.

Victor is will use his loan to buy supplies for making his products such as flour, yeast, salt, sugar, candy, and other items so that he can continue offering his customers good products such as the ones he currently makes.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar, candy, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Hawa from Kandeh town Bo, Southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 15 years old. She has two relatives that depend on her. Hawa runs a palm oil business. She has been running this business for 13 years. She works at the business from morning to night, 6 days per week. She also earns income from small-scale farming. She says that the main challenges to her business are transportation costs to bring her goods from her business place. Hawa has requested a loan in order to buy more gallons of palm oil and gari [cassava flakes]. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to change her business to a provision store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of palm oil and gari.

loans.name: Ammar Group

texts.en:
Souheir is the featured borrower of Ammar's group. She joined the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Souheir is a 47-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been working in selling bed shields, pillows, and blankets for two years. Her business is developing well. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her products' diversity with a special summer collection. She is pictured in the middle.

Zeina is a 38-year-old single woman who has been employed in a call center since 2008. The requested loan will help her buy a laptop which she will use to start an extra printing business, which will provide her with extra income. She is the one on the left.

Houeida is a 44-year-old single woman who plans to buy a television for her parents' house with the requested loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of bedding merchandise with a special summer collection.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is 42 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have two children ages 9 and 23. Only one is in school and lives at home. 

She describes herself as a hardworking person. For the past 8 years she has been running a restaurant where she sells rice and soup in the local market. She likes her business because customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by husband. She walks every day to buy her ingredients since her shop is much closer to the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry bushmeat, onions, and coal for her restaurant. She plans to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She would like to say thank you to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pepper, fish, vita, dry bushmeat, onions, and coal for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mamadou Diop

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est macon de profession, il est agé de 41ans marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans la charpenterie depuis plus de 10ans. Il ne possède pas beaucoup de matériels pendant ses chantiers ainsi il faisait la location des matériels et faisait beaucoup de dépenses. Il commence sa journée à 7h du matin pour ne descendre que 16h du soir. Monsieur Mamadou sollicite ce prêt pour pouvoir acheter du matériels telles que les pouterelles qu'il aura besoins dans son chantier sans faire recours à la location. De ce fait il va augmenter ses revenus en diminuant les dépenses qu'il faisait. Mamadou gère les dépenses quotidiennes de sa petite famille et souhaite à l'avenir acheter plus de matériaux pour ne plus faire de la location et achever ses travaux le plus rapidement possible.
texts.en:
Mamadou is a professional mason.  He is 41 years old, married, and he has a family.  He has been working in carpentry for more than 10 years.  He does not own a lot of equipment to work on construction sites.  He therefore has to rent equipment, which is very costly.  He works from 7 AM until 4 PM.

Mamadou is requesting this loan to be able to buy equipment such as small wooden beams, which he needs when working on a site, and which he otherwise has to rent.  This loan will allow him to reduce his expenses and therefore increase his income.

Mamadou manages his family's daily expenses.  In the future, he is planning to buy additional equipment, so that he does not have to rely on rented material and can finish his jobs faster.

loans.use: to buy small wooden beams to boost his activity and reduce his expenses.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de granos básicos; este le ayudara a comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, pesticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar los ingresos y estos los invierte en los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado con el crédito otorgado por Kiva.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs more operating capital so that he can continue investing in his basic grain crops. The money will help him to buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, and other supplies.

The previous loan enabled him to increase his income, which he used for the household expenses. His financial condition and family circumstances have improved as a result of the loan provided by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, pesticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 45 years old and lives in the West Point area, which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has nine children between the ages of 6 and 30. Only one is in school and lives at home. Hellen did not go to school.

Hellen describes herself as a hardworking person: for the past 13 years she has been running a table-market, selling rice, Vita, pepper, palm oil, etc., in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She walks every day to buy her goods, since her table is much closer to the wholesales area.

Hellen is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, Vita [a juice drink made by Coca Cola for the African market], pepper, palm oil, etc., for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, Vita, pepper, palm oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Achraf

texts.en:
Achraf is a 45-year-old married man, the father of five children. He is a Palestinian refugee, living and working in a Palestinian camp since he was born.

Achraf is a hardworking man with a good reputation and special customer service. He is well known for his broad smile that never leaves his face. Achraf is optimistic about everything around, and that's why he works hard to develop his social and financial living.

Achraf is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his merchandise with a new summer collection. He is specialized in selling men's clothes and shoes, and he is looking forward to expanding in the future and starting to sell women's and children's items.

Achraf is looking forward to the day he can move his shop outside the camp and attract new customers with different styles and choices.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with a new summer collection

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye est un homme marié habitant au Sénégal. Il est enseignant dans une école franco-Arabe qui se trouve dans une des localités de la ville .Il capitalise une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans l’enseignement. Par conséquent le salaire qu’il gagne lui permet  de supporter les charges de son ménage. Il est sociétaire au sein de  l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC ou  il a déjà  remboursé 03 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite a nouveau  un prêt de 300.000 francs CFA prévu   pour réfectionner la dalle de son habitat pour ne pas avoir d’ennuis pendant la saison des pluies qui s’approche déjà. Son financement lui permettra d’acheter  du  ciment, des briques, de poutrelles, du  sable de payer la main d’œuvre aux maçons  afin de réaliser son projet. La rénovation de sa maison lui permettra de mettre sa famille à l’abri des méfaits de la saison hivernale et par conséquent améliorer leur cadre de vie. Son futur projet consiste à finir la construction d’un  appartement de sa maison  en vue de le mettre en location.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is married and lives in Senegal.  He works as a teacher in a Franco-Arab school located in one of the neighborhoods of his city.  He has more than five years of experience working as a teacher and, as a result, his income allows him to cover his family's expenses.

Abdoulaye is a client of one of the branches of the U-IMCEC, and he has already repaid three previous loans.  He is requesting a new loan, in the amount of 300,000 CFA francs to repair the slab floor of his house, so that he doesn't have to face any problems during the rainy season, which is fast approaching.  Thanks to his loan, he will be able to buy some cement, sand, bricks, wooden beams, and to pay the masons who will work on this project.

Abdoulaye wants to repair his house to protect his family from the ravages of the rainy season, thereby improving their living environment.

In the future, he would like to finish building an apartment, inside his house, in order to rent it.

loans.use: to buy building materials and to pay the masons who will repair the slab floor of his house.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, de 65 años de edad, es divorciada y vive en su casa propia junto con sus 2 hijas de 20 y 22 años respectivamente quienes la acompañan y le ayudan en su negocio familiar.Lucia tiene con recreo campestre el cual esta ubicado al costado de su vivienda , este lugar cuenta con una piscina y diferentes ambientes de esparcimiento y sana diversión , además se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas, comidas y otros productos regionales.Comenta que se inicio en este negocio  porque sus amigos buscaban un lugar  donde relajarse, distraerse  y no había  un recreo adecuado , entonces decidió aperturar este negocio con distintos ambientes. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas para la atención del público.  Considera a su negocio rentable porque las personas siempre buscan un ambiente acogedor para estar con su familia.Este es su tercer crédito con Kiva y está muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 1500  soles comprará un refrigerador y bebidas gasificadas para su negocio .
texts.en:
Lucia, age 65, is divorced and lives in her own home with her two daughters (ages 20 and 22 respectively). Her daughters are by her side and help her with the family business. Lucia has a country retreat that is located next her home. This place has a swimming pool and different recreational areas for having fun. In addition, she sells soft drinks, food, and other regional products. Lucia says that she started this business because her friends were looking for a place where they could relax and unwind since there were no suitable recreational getaways. It was at that point that she decided to open a business that offered different settings.

Lucia has the help of her daughters when taking care of her guests. She considers her business to be profitable because there are always people who are looking for an inviting place to spend time with their families. This is her third loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support she has received. For this reason, she promises to submit her payments in a punctual manner. The amount of 1,500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy a refrigerator and soft drinks for her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and soft drinks for her country retreat.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
This is Jacinta. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy stock for her retail business. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. She works hard to provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Jacinta would like to apply for another loan: this time for 35,000 Kenyan shillings to dig a borehole to start selling fresh water. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to dig a borehole to start selling fresh water.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Fatmata from Torkpoi town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 3 months and 14 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 1998, Fatmata established her palm oil business. She began her business because she wanted to create income to support her family. She works at the business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are high competition in the market and sometimes sales are very slow.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase beans and palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and grow her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to change her business to a cosmetics shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase beans and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 63, is married and has nine children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is medical bills.

James has operated a business selling beans, rice, sugar and wheat flour. He sells from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the requested 50,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of wheat, maize, rice, cowpeas, sugar, and a weighing scale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat, maize, rice, cowpeas, sugar, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Kiyomuddin

texts.ru: Киёмуддину 41 год. Он женат и является отцом шестерых детей. У него четверо сыновей и двое дочерей. Он со своей большой семьей проживает в городе Куляб на юге страны. Киёмуддин занимается производством муки на своей мукомольной мельнице. Одновременно он хочет заняться торговым бизнесом. Около своего дома Киёмуддин построил помещение для продуктового магазина. Теперь, чтобы закупить товар ему необходимы денежные средства. Киёмуддин обратился за кредитом для закупа продуктов питания. И ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Kiyomuddin is 41 years old.  He is married and is the father of six children.  He has four sons and two daughters.  He lives with his large family in the city of Kulob in the south of the country.  Kiyomuddin makes flour at his flour mill.  Simultaneously he would like to start a retail business.  Kiyomuddin built a space for a grocery store near his home.  Now, he needs financial resources in order to purchase products for sale.  Kiyomuddin applied for a loan to purchase food products.  He is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food products

loans.name: Fanah

texts.en:
Fanah is 35 years old and lives in the West Point area, which is the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband sells palm oil. They both have two children, ages 5 and 16, who are in school and live at home. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. For the past five years, she has been running a table where she sells door locks, hinges, nails, spoons, etc., in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Most of the time she walks to buy her goods, since her table is much closer to the wholesales area.

Fanah is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, spoons, etc., for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, spoons, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 37 years old and widowed with six children, ages 5 years to 19 years. She runs a cookery business in Kandeh town, Bo, in Sierra Leone. Her children are going to school. She was just a housewife; she started the business because her husband died.

She's been in this business for five years and sells cookery at her house. She says that the main challenge to her business is if the food is not finished, she will run at a loss.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase food items like rice, onions and cooking oil. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her take care of her children's welfare and increase her business. In the future, she would like to open a restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase food items like rice, onions and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products in order to open a grocery store and increase her family's capital.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name of Dilrabo lives in a flat that is in bad condition. She is 20 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. For a year she has worked in the Sports Center as an HR specialist. She uses her salary to provide her family with all necessities, as her parents have a small income. For several years Dilrabo and her parents have wanted to repair their flat, but they have not had sufficient money. She is asking for a loan of 2500 somoni to buy wallpaper. 

After repairs, her flat will be very comfortable and as a result she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy. In the future she has a great plan to be a successful lady.

loans.use: to buy wallpaper for repairing her flat.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married and has three children between 18 and 20 years old; they live at home and are in school. Unfortunately, Mary's parent did not send her to school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is not working for now. 

For the past 10 years, she has been selling charcoal in the local market. For now, she faces no serious problems. She spends six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. on her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She hopes to build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia by enabling small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms. Mumtaz is a 45-year-old married mother of six children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing and health. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family members alone. She started her business of stitching clothes to contribute to the family income. 

She is very familiar with the techniques of stitching. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Currently, she requests a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees to buy stock of thread in different colors with packs of buttons, zippers and needles, so then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors with packs of buttons, zippers and needles.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 37-year-old Isatu from Kandeh town, Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 20 years. Her children are attending school. She started this business because she does not want to depend on her husband alone. 

Isatu runs a plastic and rubber business; she sells food containers, baskets, cups and buckets. She has been running this business for eight years. She works at the business throughout the week and has her younger sister help her to run the business. Isatu says that her business is doing well out of the loans she usually takes; it helps her to increase her business and have a huge profit. 

Isatu has requested a loan in order to buy different kinds of food containers, baskets, cups and buckets. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and start a savings account. In the future, she plans to a buy a plot of land. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy different kinds of plastic food containers, baskets, cups and buckets.

loans.name: Julio Adalberto

texts.es: Don julio de 30 años de edad  vive con su esposa y su hijo en casa propia, el  se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz, sorgo y jocote, con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas  logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, don julio solicita un crédito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas, semillas, etc.  y poder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Don Julio is 30 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. He has been a farmer for several years and his main crops are corn, sorghum, and hog plums. From the sale of his harvested crops, he is able to cover his household expenses.

Don Julio is requesting a loan in order to buy compost, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and other supplies so that he can continue with planting his crops. This will enable him to generate more income and provide a better life for his wife and child.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ms. Ghazala is a 42-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure, so she decided to work to initiate her own business to support her family for a better future. 

Twenty-five years ago, she began a business of football manufacturing in her house. Over time, she has become famous in her town for providing good quality footballs and earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. Ghazala is a motivated mother and liable to provide them with good quality food, education and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers with spools of threads in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which will ultimately help in increasing her income.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers with spools of threads to manufacture footballs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years old and lives in the West Point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is selling used clothes. They have two children, aged 9 and 12, who are in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking person.  

For the past three years, she has been running a table where she sells rice, red oil and charcoal in the local market. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by husband. She walks every day to buy her inventory since her table is much closer to the wholesales area.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, red oil and charcoal for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house. She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia to enable small business people to increase their business volume.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, red oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús de 56 años de edad , es una mujer buena y amable, esta casada y tiene una hija que ya es mayor de edad e independiente a quien educó y alimentó con mucho amor, actualmente vive solo con su esposo.El negocio de Jesús consiste en la venta de productos comestibles, todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto. Su pequeña tienda es la más surtida de su zona y sus clientes la prefieren por la calidad de los artículos que ofrece, además del trato tan cordial y la amabilidad que expresa a cada uno de sus clientes. De igual manera dedica parte de su tiempo a la siembra y cosecha de diversos productos regionales principalmente plátano, yuca y algunos frutales.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su tienda, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy contenta al saber que tiene un respaldo económico para seguir avanzando en el cumplimiento de sus metas razón por la cual se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará diversos productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, embutidos, pan, huevos, verduras, carnes y otros.
texts.en:
Jesús, 56, is a good and friendly woman.  She's married and has an adult daughter who's independent, whom she raised and nourished with a lot of love.  Currently she lives alone with her husband.

Jesús's business is selling food products.  Every day she opens her doors to her store very early to wait on her customers who go to her looking for some product.  Her small store is the best stocked in her area and her customers prefer it for the quality of the articles she sells as well as for her cordial service and the friendliness she shows to each one of her customers.

She also devotes part of her time to growing and harvesting a variety of regional products, mainly bananas, yuca, and some fruit trees.  What she likes most about her job is talking to her customers and seeing them begin the day with a smile.  She thinks the hardest part is having to get up early to see to her store.  She knows it's her job, though, and she has to do it.  She hopes that her business will grow in the future and give her a better income.

Currently she'll request a loan for 3000 soles [PEN].  She's very happy to know she has financial support to continue making progress in achieving her goals, which is why she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount she'll buy a variety of food products, such as rice, sugar, milk, cold cuts, bread, eggs, vegetables, meat, and other things.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, eggs, and other products

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Ms. Asma is a 26-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure, so she decided to initiate her own business of a general store to support her family for a better future. She has gained two years of experience in this field, and has attained a regular list of customers. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Due to this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase packs of biscuits, oil and juices. It would help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately will help in increasing her profits.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, oil and juices.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора замужняя женщина с двумя детьми. Ей 33 года. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде. В данный момент ее муж находится на заработках за границей. Гулнора работает продавщицей и наравне мужа обеспечивает семью. На центральном рынке города у нее имеется магазин. Она продает продукты питания, в частности: чай, кофе, сахар, конфеты, печенье, растительное масло, майонез, кетчуп и т.д. Гулнора занимается торговлей уже два года. По натуре Гулнора доброжелательный и отзывчивый человек. Она обходится своими клиентами с уважением и старается обслуживать их качественно. Сейчас Гулнора намерена увеличить товарооборот и запрашивает кредит для закупа ассортимента продуктов питания.
texts.en: Gulnora is a married woman with two children. She is 33 years old. Gulnora lives in Tursun-zoda. Currently her husband works as a migrant abroad. Gulnora herself works in retail and contributes equally with her husband to her family's financial wellbeing. She rents a grocery store at the central city market where she sells various products, such as tea, coffee, sugar, candy, cookies, oil, mayonaise, ketchup etc. Gulnora has been managing her store for two years. She is naturally a kindhearted and empathic person. She is always respectful to her clients and tries to provide them with quality products. Currently Gulnora plans to increase goods turnover rate in her store and is requesting a loan to purchase additional grocery inventory.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of groceries for her store

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Ms. Sugran is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at her house. The man shown in the photo is Sugran’s husband. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Sugran is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 35,000 Pakistan rupees to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун молодой парень в возрасте 21 лет. Он не женат и живет со своими родителями. Фаридун с детство занимается торговлей. Он занимается  продажей пищевых продуктов. В обороте у Фаридуна  имеется около 10000 долларов США. В особые дни он продает в оптом  а другие дни в розницу. Его отец и мать тоже занимаются продажей пищевых продуктов только в розницу на базаре. Чтобы помочь  своим родителям Фаридун самостоятельно занимается своим бизнесом и чтобы в дальнейшем развивать свой бизнес он хочет получит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США сроком на 18  месяцев. Заранее благодарит за нашу поддержку.
texts.en: Faridun is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. Faridun has been working in retail since childhood. He sells groceries. Faridun has a working capital of about 10000 US dollars. He sells groceries whole sale on certain days and directly to customers on others. His father and mother also sell groceries to customers at the local market. In order to help his parents Fridun runs his own independent business and wants to expand it. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 2000 US dollars for 18 months. Faridun thanks all his supporters in advance.

loans.use: for increase the assortment of groceries

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 31 years old and married with three children, ages 3 years to 15 years. She runs a palm oil business at Moriba town, Bo, in Sierra Leone. Two of her children are attending school.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells palm oil at a Sunday marketplace. She describes her major problem to be the difficulty of transportation. 

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more gallons of palm oil alongside with gari (a food made from cassava) and beans. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil alongside with gari (a food made form cassava) and beans.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Ms. Shameem is a 50-year-old vigorous lady and a mother of six children. She deals in making and supplying bags and sacks which are used to store cotton and crushed wheat. She has gained 12 years of experience in this field. She stitches bags for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase cloth material such as cotton and nylon with some spools of threads in large quantity to inflate her sales. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material such as cotton and nylon with some spools of threads in large quantity.

loans.name: Gulam- Fiza

texts.en: Ms Gulam- Fiza is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. Five years ago, she started a beauty parlor business at the corner of her house. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street and makes enough to meet the household expenditures. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to buy skin care products, bleaching and whitening creams, and packs of hair rollers. In this way, she will be able to deal to more customers time after time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy skin care products, bleaching and whitening creams, and packs of hair rollers.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора 31 год, умная,жизнерадостная,общительная женщина,замужем, мать троих детей. Так как она без высшего образования немогла работать в госучреждениях и зарабатывать. И для того, чтобы включить свой вклад для содержания семьи с 2008 года начала заниматься бизнесом, то есть продажей детской одежды. Кроме этого Нигора дополнительно занимается откормом КРС на дому. По бизнесу Нигоре помогает муж. Муж Нигоры занимается перевозкой гравей и песка. В течении нескольких лет от дохода своего бизнеса Нигора с мужем смогли построить дом и улучшили себе уловия жизни. На полученный кредит Нигора хочет отремонтировать детскую комнату. Нигора надеется на Вашу поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Nigora is 31 years old, smart, energetic and social woman. She is married and has three children. Nigora does not have a college degree so she cannot work in a government office. In order to contribute to her family's support she has started a children's clothing shop in 2008. Aside from retail Nigora also raises cattle at home. Nigora's husband supports her business ventures and also transports gravel and sand for a living. After accumulating profits from her business for a few years Nigora and her husband were able to build a new house and improve their living conditions. Now Nigora is requesting a loan to also improve the children's room in her new home. Nigora hopes for you support and help.

loans.use: to repair of the children room in her house

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru: Нозигул молодая замужняя женщина. Ей 21 год. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Нозигул вместе с мужем занимается торговлей. Они продают различные ткани для платья в своем районе проживания. Этим бизнесом они занимаются уже в течение 5 лет. Нозигул сейчас хотела бы увеличить товарооборот. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит для закупа тканей. В будущем Нозигул планирует расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Nozigul is a young married woman. She is 21 years old. She lives in Tursun-Zoda. Nozigul works in retail together with her husband. They sell various fabrics for dresses in their region. They have been running this business for 5 years. Nozigul wants to expand her goods turnover rate and is requesting a loan to purchase new fabrics for the store. In the future Nozigul plans to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Terminal Iv Group

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Liset es madre soltera, tiene 37 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 4 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de bolsas y carteras para damas, inició este negocio con su madre y con poco capital, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia; ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo y decide solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá para la compra de 4 docenas de bolsas y 1 docena de carteras de diferentes estilos y colores, para surtir su venta, en el futuro que se acerca desea que su negocio prospere en manera grande; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio minorista como venta por catalogo, venta de zapatos, venta de panadería y el compañero es taxista. En la fotografía se puede visualizar la prescencia de 7 personas, pero, solamente a 5 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Liset is a single mother who is 37 years old. She completed a sixth-grade education and has four children, three of whom are studying. Sandra buys and sells handbags and pocketbooks for women. She and her mother started this business with little capital. Sandra now has 10 years of experience and is able to support her family.

She organized a group and decided to request a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of four dozen handbags and one dozen pocketbooks of different styles and colors. Sandra will be able to restock her shop. In the near future, she would like for her business to prosper on a grand scale.

The other group members are small businesspeople who sell products through catalogs, sell shoes, sell bread, and work as a taxi driver. The photograph shows seven people, but only five of them were granted a loan.

loans.use: to buy handbags and pocketbooks.

loans.name: Las Flores De Pologua Group

texts.es:
La señora Amelia de estado civil casada, tiene 32 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 2 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, ella se dedica a la preparacion de refacciones para vender, inició este negocio trabajando en un comedor y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es fletero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su capital de trabajo, comprando insumos para preparar refacciones diversas, en el futuro próximo desea tener un capital grande y obtener mejores ganancias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a la prestación de servicios.
texts.en:
Amelia, 32, is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  She finished three years of elementary school.

She makes a living preparing refreshments to sell.  She started this business working in a restaurant and currently has four years of experience.  She has the complete support of her husband, who's a freight driver.

She's organizing a group to be able to request a loan that she'll use to expand her working capital by buying ingredients to prepare a variety of refreshments.  She wants to have a lot of capital and get better profits in the near future.

The other members of the group make a living in retail and providing services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food

loans.name: Mahmuda

texts.ru: Махмуда жительница города Турсунзаде, расположенный в центрально-западной части Таджикистана. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и является матерью двоих детей. Ее муж работает в пекарне и занимается выпеканием и продажей лепешек. Сама Махмуда занимается вышиванием у себя дома. Она шьет национальные платья и коврики для молитвы. Махмуда занимается этим ремеслом с 13 лет. Кредит запрашивает для закупа ниток и тканей для вышивания. Махмуда очень благодарна своим родителям за то, что они дали ей возможность обучиться этому делу. Так как за счет своего ремесла она помогает мужу поддерживать быт.
texts.en: Mahmuda lives in Tursun-Zoda, located in the cental-western region of Tajikistan. She is 33 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a baker and makes Tajik flatbread. Mahmuda is a seamstress. She sews and embroiders traditional Tajik dresses and prayer rugs. She has been embroidering since she was 13 years old and is very experienced. Mahmuda is very grateful to her parents for giving her the opportunity to learn embroidery as she can now use her talent to help her husband support the family.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery floss and fabric

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru:
Фаррух житель города Душанбе. Ему 28 лет. Он холост. Фаррух по профессии юрист. На данный момент он работает милиционером. Фаррух живет вместе с отцом, матерью, братом и сестрой.  
Фаррух обратился в Хумо за кредитом для приобретения автомашины марки Мерседес. Он хочет работать таксистом в свободное от работы время, так как ему необходим дополнительный заработок. Он намерен предоставлять услугу, такси. У Фарруха имеется опыт, он хорошо водит машину.
texts.en: Farrukh lives in Dushanbe. He is 28 years old, single and has a degree in law. Currently Farrukh works as a policeman. He lives with his father, mother, brother and sister. Farrukh has turned to Humo for a loan to purchase a Mercedes brand vehicle. He wants to works as a taxi driver in his free time, as he needs additional income to support himself. He is planning to use the car to provide taxi servies. Farrukh has a lot of experience and is an excellent driver.

loans.use: to purchase a Mercedes vehicle for use as a taxi service during his spare time for additional profits.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Ms. Shazia is a 22-year-old single lady; she has been in the beauty parlor business for the past three years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
El Sr. Amado es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha y quiere seguir creciendo, este es su segundo crédito en Kivz, ya que el crédito anterior lo ha utilizado para la compra de insumos para su pequeña despensa, lo cual le ayudo mucho. 
Amado esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que recibió ya que por medio de eso pudo mejorar un poco mas su negocio y dar mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Solicita esta nueva ayuda para poder comprar frutas, verduras, productos a granel, lácteos y demás para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma seguir creciendo y dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Sr. Amado is a hardworking and enterprising individual who strives to keep growing. This is his second loan with Kiva. His previous loan was used to buy provisions for his small food pantry and it was a great help.

Amado is very grateful for the opportunity he received. As a result, he was able to make a slight improvement to his business and provide more variety to his customers. He is requesting a new loan so that he can buy fruits, vegetables, grains, dairy products, and other items to restock his business. This will allow him to continue growing and provide his customers with what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, grains, dairy products, and other items.

loans.name: Abduhalim

texts.ru: Абдухалиму 31 год и проживает он в городе Турсунзаде. Он женат и имеет одного ребенка. Абдухалим единственный кормилец в семье. Он занимается сельским хозяйством. У него имеется участок земли, на котором он выращивает овощи, в основном картофель. Он занимается растениеводством уже 8 лет и за счет дохода, получаемого с этой деятельности он обеспечивает семью. Абдухалим обратился за кредитом для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая картофеля. В будущем он планирует расширить свое сельское хозяйство.
texts.en: Abduhalim is 31 years old and lives in Tursun-zoda. He is married and has one child. Abduhalim is the sole provider for his family. He is a farmer who has a plot of land where he grows vegetables, primarily potatoes. He has been farming for 8 years and has been able to use the profits to support his family. Abduhalim has turned to us for a loan which he will use to purchase fertilizer for his potato fields. In the future he is planning to expand his farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his potato crop

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил житель города Турсунзаде. Ему 43 года. У него жена и трое детей. Абдучалил имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь сельским хозяйством. У него имеется участок орошаемой земли, на котором он выращивает картофель и рис. Абдучалил опытный дехканин. Он занимается растениеводством в течение 11 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения минеральных удобрений для урожая картофеля и риса. Абдучалил хочет получить богатый урожай и за счет прибыли с продажи урожая женить своего старшего сына.
texts.en: Abdujalil lives in Tursun-Zoda. He is 43 years old and has a wife and three children. Abdujalil has a high school degree and works as a farmer. He has a plot of irrigated land where he grows potatoes and rice. He is an experienced farmer and has been working for 11 years. He is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer for his potato and rice crops. He hopes to be able to collect a big harvest and use the profits from the sale to pay for the wedding of his eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his potato and rice fields

loans.name: Hayatan

texts.en: Ms Hayatan is a 38-year-old married woman; she has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (goats) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She has gained five years of experience in this field.  Initially, she faced problems in running her business, but after getting loan from Kashf Foundation, she was able to establish her business. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs.30, 000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Marelvis

texts.es: Marelvis de 38 años es madre de tres hijos en las edades de 2, 6 y 20 años. Ella desde el año 2009 emprendió su propia aventura de negocios, después de haber realizado un curso de repostería, y panadería en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, donde aprendió las mejores técnicas de cocción de estos productos. Hoy preparar tortas, flanes, postres y ha agregado últimamente almuerzos, con lo cual genera ingresos que benefician a su familia que de ella depende. Sus compras las realiza de contado en tiendas y supermercados y sus ventas las realiza también de la misma forma; para poder  ampliar su mercado y organizar su negocio como restaurante,  requiere mas capital y esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una estufa industrial, con la que mejorará su infraestructura y poco a poco estaría cumpliendo su sueño de prosperidad.  Así Marelvis y sus hijos saldrán adelante con el esfuerzo realizado por ella en su trabajo autónomo.
texts.en:
Marelvis, 38, is the mother of three children, ages 2, 6, and 20.  In 2009 she set up her own business venture after taking a course in pastry-making and baking at the Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, where she learned the best cooking techniques for these products.

Today she makes cakes, flan, and dessert, and recently she added lunch.  She earns an income that benefits her family, which is dependent on her.  She makes her purchases in cash in stores and supermarkets.  She also makes her sales the same way.

She needs more capital to be able to expand her market and organize her business as a restaurant.  This is exactly why she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With it she'll buy an industrial stove to improve her infrastructure and little by little achieve her dream of prosperity.  This way Marelvis and her children will get ahead with her effort in her autonomous job.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Ms. Kalsoom is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for their better future. Eight years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. So, she applied for a second loan of Rs. 30,000 with Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace and zippers to create a means of increasing revenue, so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace and zippers.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Ms Shakila is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Shakila’s son; he assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of the family members. Currently, Shakila requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to buy packs of pulses, biscuits and beverages to inflate her sales. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of pulses, biscuits and beverages to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 29-year-old Mamie from Moriba town Bo. She is married with two children between the ages of  two and ten years. One child is going to school. 

Mamie runs a grocery business; she sells cigarettes, sweets, milk, and candles at home. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business from morning to night, seven days per week. Mamie says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mamie has requested a loan in order to buy more general store items like cigarettes, sweets, milk, and candles for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her installment and increase her business. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more general store items like cigarettes, sweets, milk and candles for resale.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms Perveen is a 53-year-old married woman who is doing a business of milk sales for the past 16 years. She has one buffalo in milk; she sells its milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her decent life. She has two children; one of them is school going. She is very motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. Currently, she needs to purchase another buffalo to increase the production milk. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to Kashf Foundation. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers in her vicinity, which will ultimately help her to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Ms Rabia is a 25-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Rabia makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs. 45,000 that she will use to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. Rabia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Ms. Nusrat is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up. Then, her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 8th loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Ms Tahira is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. She buys animals (baby goats & baby cows) at low prices and brings them up. Then her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving quality food, health and education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена работает на одном из местных рынков Новой Каховки. Торгует детской верхней одеждой, в торговле занята уже 10 лет. Бутик имеет свой, но приходится арендовать землю у администрации рынка. 
Елене понадобились дополнительные средства в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы съездить закупить летний ассортимент детской одежды.
texts.en:
Yelena works at one of the local markets in Novaya Kahovka.  She sells children's outdoor clothing.  She has been involved in retail for 10 years already.  She has her own store but she needs to rent the land from the market administration.

Yelena needs an additional 5,000 hryvnia in funds, in order to go and buy an assortment of children's summer clothes.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's summer clothes.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Ms Perveen is a 34-year-old hard working married lady. She has been doing a business of milk sales for the past 20 years. She is successfully running her business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Perveen’s husband. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis. Over time, they have become popular for providing good quality milk in their local community and earn enough income to meet their children’s expenses. She has some savings and applied a second loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo to keep up with the demands of her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and Kashf for their support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en: Elgun is 28 years old. Elgun is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border, with his mother.
